org.codice.ddf.configuration.migration

Class ExportMigrationContextImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codice.ddf.configuration.migration.MigrationContextImpl<ExportMigrationReportImpl>
      • org.codice.ddf.configuration.migration.ExportMigrationContextImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, ExportMigrationContext, MigrationContext

    public class ExportMigrationContextImpl
extends MigrationContextImpl<ExportMigrationReportImpl>
implements ExportMigrationContext, Closeable
    The export migration context keeps track of exported migration entries for a given migratable while processing an export migration operation.

    • Method Detail

      • getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry

        public Optional<ExportMigrationEntry> getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ExportMigrationContext
        Creates or retrieves (if already created) a migration entry referenced from the specified system property to be exported by the corresponding migratable.

        An error will automatically be recorded with the associated migration report if the system property is not defined or its value is blank.

        Note: The file referenced from the property is assumed to be relative to ${ddf.home} if not defined as absolute. All paths will automatically be relativized from ${ddf.home} if located underneath.

        The entry returned would be an entry representing the file that was referenced by the specified system property value on the current system. For example:

        If system properties defines the following mapping: javax.net.ssl.keyStore=etc/keystores/serverKeystore.jks

        when the following code: 

             final Optional<ExportMigrationEntry> entry
         = context.getSystemPropertyReferenceEntry("javax.net.ssl.keyStore");

        would return an entry representing the local file etc/keystores/serverKeystore.jks giving the migratable a chance to export it alongside the original system property value so it can be later restored and the property value can be verified after the import operation such that it would still be defined with the same value.

        Specified by:
        getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry in interface ExportMigrationContext
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the system property referencing a migration entry to create or retrieve
        Returns:
        a new migration entry or the existing one if already created for the migration entry referenced from the specified system property value or empty if the property is not defined or its value is blank

      • getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry

        public Optional<ExportMigrationEntry> getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry(String name,
                                                                       BiPredicate<MigrationReport,String> validator)
        Description copied from interface: ExportMigrationContext
        Creates or retrieves (if already created) a migration entry referenced from the specified system property to be exported by the corresponding migratable.

        The provided predicate is always invoked (as long as the entry was not previously created) to validate the property value which may be null if not defined. Returning false will abort the process and yield an Optional.empty() being returned out of this method. In such case, it is up to the validator to record any required errors or warnings. Returning true from the predicate will allow for a new entry to be created for the corresponding system property unless the property is not defined or its value is blank in which case an error will be recorded and an Optional.empty() is returned from this method. In other words:

        1. If the predicate returns false, no migration entry is created and no error is recorded.
        2. If the predicate returns true and ...
          1. If the property is not defined or its value is blank, no migration entry is created and an error is recorded
          2. Otherwise, a new migration entry is created and returned

        Note: The file referenced from the property is assumed to be relative to ${ddf.home} if not defined as absolute. All paths will automatically be relativized from ${ddf.home} if located underneath.

        Specified by:
        getSystemPropertyReferencedEntry in interface ExportMigrationContext
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the system property referencing a migration entry to create or retrieve
        validator - a predicate to be invoked to validate the property value further which must return true to have a migration entry created and returned
        Returns:
        a new migration entry or the existing one if already created for the migration entry referenced from the specified system property value or empty if the property is not defined or is invalid

      • getEntry

        public ExportMigrationEntry getEntry(Path path)
        Description copied from interface: ExportMigrationContext
        Creates or retrieves (if already created) a migration entry to be exported by the corresponding migratable corresponding to the specified path.

        Note: The file referenced is assumed to be relative to ${ddf.home} if not defined as absolute. All paths will automatically be relativized from ${ddf.home} if located underneath.

        Specified by:
        getEntry in interface ExportMigrationContext
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to be exported
        Returns:
        a new migration entry for the corresponding migratable or the existing one if already created

      • entries

        public Stream<ExportMigrationEntry> entries(Path path)
        Description copied from interface: ExportMigrationContext
        Recursively walks the provided path's tree to create or retrieve (if already created) entries for all files found and returns existing or new migration entries for each one of them.

        Note: Files referenced are assumed to be relative to ${ddf.home} if not defined as absolute. All paths will automatically be relativized from ${ddf.home} if located underneath.

        Specified by:
        entries in interface ExportMigrationContext
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the directory to recursively walk
        Returns:
        a stream of all created or retrieved entries corresponding to all files recursively found under path

      • entries

        public Stream<ExportMigrationEntry> entries(Path path,
                                            PathMatcher filter)
        Description copied from interface: ExportMigrationContext
        Recursively walks the provided path's tree to create or retrieve (if already created) entries for all files found that match the provided path filter and returns existing or new migration entries for each one of them.

        Note: Files referenced are assumed to be relative to ${ddf.home} if not defined as absolute. All paths will automatically be relativized from ${ddf.home} if located underneath.

        Specified by:
        entries in interface ExportMigrationContext
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the directory to recursively walk
        filter - the path filter to use
        Returns:
        a stream of all created or retrieved entries corresponding to all files recursively found under path which matches the given filter
